data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD have smooth road to $1,900 as US PCE Inflation, Fed loom – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) sticks onto the US GDP-inflicted bearish bias as the metal traders await the Federal Reserve's (Fed) preferred inflation gauge, namely the US Core Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) Price Index details for December. In addition to the pre-data anxiety, confirmation of the six-week-old rising wedge bearish chart pattern also keeps XAU/USD sellers hopeful.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD refreshes day's high above $1,930 ahead of Fed's preferred inflation gauge
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) has refreshed its day's high at $1,935.00 in the Asian session. The precious metal picked strength after a minor drop below $1,930.00, which poised a bargain opportunity for gold buyers.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD teases bears ahead of Federal Reserve's favorite United States inflation gauge
data.text: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD teases bears ahead of Federal Reserve's favorite United States inflation gauge

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: GC 1923 Still in Play – Can Bulls Tag 2k?
data.text: The bullish trend in Gold continues to hold even as bulls have begun to face a bit of turbulence around the prior ATH of 1923.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bears are on the prowl after United States Gross Domestic Product strength
data.text: Gold price dropped to a low of $1,918.69 on Thursday due to a stronger US Dollar on generally solid United States of America economic data on the day that may prompt the Federal Reserve, Fed, to keep interest rates higher for longer. The market was wrong-footed in anticipation of ongoing disinflationary numbers and this has led to a move up to a critical technical level in the US Dollar in the set-up for the next bout of important data from the US economy.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD slips toward $1930s on solid US GDP, traders eye PCE
data.text: Gold price retreats after hitting a nine-month high of $1949.16 and dips beneath the $1940 mark, following the release of the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) preliminary reading in the United States (US), amongst other data. Therefore, the XAU/USD is trading at 1933.40, below the opening price by 0.49%.

data.title: XAU/USD: Bulls Take a Breather Ahead of Key US GDP Data
data.text: Gold price eases from new multi-month high ($1949) in European trading on Thursday, as larger bulls take a breather ahead of release of key US GDP data.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD retreats from multi-month top amid modest USD recovery, ahead of US GDP
data.text: Gold price retreats from the vicinity of the $1,950 level or the highest level since April 2022 touched this Thursday and extends its descent through the first half of the European session. The XAU/USD drops to a fresh daily low, around the $1,935 area in the last hour, and for now, seems to have snapped a three-day winning streak.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD buyers could retain control if US GDP dismisses recession fears
data.text: Gold price bulls take a breather just below $1,950 after the ongoing upsurge. XAU/USD eyes critical US events for the next move, FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta reports.

data.title: Gold Futures: Door open to extra gains
data.text: CME Group's flash data for gold futures markets noted open interest resumed the uptrend and went up by around 11.7K contracts on Wednesday, reversing at the same time the previous drop. Volume, instead, left behind two consecutive daily builds and shrank by more than 13K contracts.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD fails to kiss $1,950 as USD Index attempts recovery
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) has sensed selling pressure while attempting to kiss the critical resistance of $1,950.00. The precious metal is not getting the desired strength required to hit the $1,950.00 hurdle as investors are getting anxious ahead of the release of the United States Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and other critical economic data.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bears need validation from $1,920 and US GDP – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) retreats from a nine-month high as bulls await the key US data/events for further directions while aiming for the fresh multi-month peak surrounding the mid-$1,900s. In addition to the cautious mood ahead of the key US growth and inflation data, a light calendar and contrasting plays between the Federal Reserve (Fed) and the European Central Bank (ECB) officials also seem to weigh on the Gold price of late.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls approach $1,967 ahead of United States Gross Domestic Product
data.text: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls approach $1,967 ahead of United States Gross Domestic Product

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eyes $1,950 as US Dollar Index cracks, US Q4 GDP eyed
data.text: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eyes $1,950 as US Dollar Index cracks, US Q4 GDP eyed

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD is expected to rally further – Credit Suisse
data.text: Os Tuesday, Gold XAU/USD registered its highest daily close since April. Strategists at Credit Suisse expect the yellow metal to enjoy further gains.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD dwindles around $1940, retraced as traders eye US Q4 GDP
data.text: Gold snaps two days of gains and retreats from weekly highs reached around $1942.51, stumbles beneath the $1940 figure amid a risk-off impulse that weighed on safe-haven assets, including the US Dollar (USD). US Treasury bond yields are also edging lower in a gold move that appears to be driven by profit-taking.

data.title: Weekly markets TL;DR: Tesla earnings, gold nears all-time high, important economic data to come
data.text: Earnings season continues in stock market, with Microsoft spelling caution yesterday and Tesla to follow today.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD pulls away from multi-month top, slides below $1,925 level
data.text: Gold price edges lower on Wednesday and moves away from a nine-month high, around the $1,942-$1,943 area touched the previous day. The XAU/USD remains on the defensive through the first half of the European session and is currently placed near the daily low, just below the $1,925 level, down nearly 0.70% for the day.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD to see a price correction in the short-term – ANZ
data.text: Gold trades near $1,930 as the weaker US Dollar continues to lend support. Economists at ANZ Bank expect a downside correction in the near term.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD correction could see a retest of the $1,900 barrier
data.text: Gold price returns to the red. As FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta notes, $1,940 is a tough nut to crack for XAU/USD bulls.
